lexUnit.name: rotate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move in a circle around a fixed axis

sentence.text: They rotated three times on the plank and the chain was removed .
He went silent and dark and withdrew into himself , the two thumbs rotating about one another as he sat in the car chair by the fire .
An impeller fan , rotating at a maximum of 7,000rpm , sucks air and any loose garden debris up the tube and into the attached canvas bag .
These " Kerr " black holes rotate at a constant rate , their size and shape depending only on their mass and rate of rotation .
Bernice watched , amazed , as a spiral of pink flesh rotated in the air behind the Doctor .
A hurricane is a storm of strong circular wind flow which rotates in a counter-clockwise direction .
The balloon rotated gently in the evening breeze , presenting its serial number to him .
Moving like a boy in treacle , I rotate on the axis of my right knee and pick up the yard and a half of large bore nozzle between hands slick with sweat .
He rotated on his right heel and left toe and brought the left boot alongside the right with a delicate crash which trembled his pink jowls .
The snag to this is that although a pan-head can rotate through a full circle , your hips are limited to about a quarter of this movement .
These particles rotate with the star and help to slow it , transferring the spin to the outer reaches of the globular dust cloud .
The mirror would then rotate in proportion to the strength of the current .
The teak paddles began to rotate , making little more than a whisper of sound as they gently scythed the warm air .
The escape pod was rotating so rapidly that its four occupants were pinned against their couches .
